name: Seaside Los Jameos Playa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A mate and I spent a week here, half board. We booked the cheapest room type and ended up on the ground floor with a terrace overlooking the pool area.
reviews.title: Good but not excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side...
reviews.title: Room with no view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a fairly decent size and spotless, although the decor was a bit dated. No problems with maid service.
reviews.title: lovely old grand hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout. Although our room wasn't ready when we arrived, we were given a drinks voucher which we were able to use at the pool bar. One night my friend ordered a whisky which it turned out they didn't have, so he went for a cheaper option instead. They refunded the difference and the waiter poured an extremely generous measure by way of compensation.
reviews.title: Another wonderful trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The area around the pool is good for sunbathing and there is no shortage of loungers.
reviews.title: No air conditioning!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have to say I wasn't expecting much as the price was so good BUT...
reviews.title: The Best Kept Secret In Lanzarote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW what a fab resort, everything from the gorgeous fresh food (and the yummy chocolate fountain!) to the lovely rooms and joyful staff made our trip extremely pleasurable.
reviews.title: Fantastic All-Inclusive Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean and well kept, the rooms nicely decorated and comfortable. The only minor irritation was the TV picture and sound was a little temperamental.
reviews.title: Enjoyable first trip to Lazarote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff could not have been more attentive and appear to genuinely enjoy their work, we were told by repeat guests that many of the staff had been there 10 years plus.
reviews.title: Second to None

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We upgraded to a sea view room which was lovely, even though the hotel is fairly close to the airport, even on busy days there was no noise to worry about.
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel has a very nice interior and exterior set in quite peacefull surroundings 3 mins walk from the beach. Facilities are excellent which include a good gym, general store for essentials(sunscreen,shades,travel plug,literature etc) 4 tennis courts with friendly doubles/singles tournamants, sauna/steam room, hairdresser and games room. There are themed buffet dinners most nights and the variety of food is great, breakfast was my fav, they have wide selection of cereals and bread, there are healthy options and not so healthy ones. The rooms are very nice aswell and you have water and two small bottles of wine comp waiting fro you. There are about 30 tv channels mostly spanish and german but they have sky sports, eurosport, sky movies, cnn, sky news and bbc news.
reviews.title: superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and my 2 year odl daughter returned last night from 2 weeks at the Jameos Playa. Absolutely world class food, staff and services. Don't under estimate my review, I stay all over the world on business in some very expensive places....
reviews.title: UNREAL. WORLD CLASS... 5 Star for the price of 4 Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The waiters - every single one of them go the extra 10 yards with your kids, they love to see you and you children smiling and will do anything you ask of them.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great location, Fab food, Brilliant Managers & Staff....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pool & Views - We booked with TravelRepublic.co.uk and paid for the "Pool View". It was worth the extra £60 because the pool area is stunning to wake up to and when lit up at night is breathtaking.
reviews.title: Not bad but the food .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Location - Excellent. For me Lanzarote is a pretty worn out place, the beeches aren't eyecatching, Peurto del carmen has the worst selection of shops I think I've ever seen (except the shopping centre) and the hotels up there look quite small. Jameos Playa is out of Puerto del carmen by about 15 minutes walk. The location of this hotel is in a quiet area with some local bars, supermarkets etc for supplies. If you want to get to the busy areas they're there if you want them. For us, this hotel was so perfect in every way that we only left the hotel 5 times and twice it was to visit the supermarket! So Puerto Del Carmen wasn't of interest.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived I have to say that after the fantastic first impression of the hotel we didn`t get off to the best of starts. We arrived to find two receptionists in a heated debate with one of their spanish customers and we were basically ignored for the first few minutes when finally one of them did come over and asked if we could wait for a further moment or two!!
reviews.title: lets be honest here, great hotel but.....

likes.liked: — the setting, the room, the pool area and mostly the food
likes.disliked: — hot food needs to be hot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Eventually a third receptionist did arrive but took an age to book us in.( at this stage you can imagine the words of the poor reviews were running through my head). Finally the porter was called over but no our room wasn`t quite ready. So we waited and I suddenly noticed the bottle of cava nearby - the porter saw me looking and hey presto two glasses of chilled cava to calm us.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever

likes.liked: — friendly efficient staff and range of activities for children/teenagers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When we arrived at our room I have to say it was immaculate but something was not quite right - then I realised - I had booked and paid for a suite - this was not a suite. Back to reception!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Great Value for Money
reviews.text: Eventually all was sorted and we were presented with a bottle of Cava as a peace offering.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now it gets better.
reviews.title: Sheer Bliss!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week in Hotel Jameos Puerto Del Carmen, the location of the hotel was excellent ,a stroll through the beautiful hotel gardens and you are on the promenade. We picked this hotel because of other recent positive TA reviews, we were not disappointed. We stayed B&B and the breakfast was excellent buffet style with a wide selection of hot and cold. We dined in the hotel one evening, and again the food and choice were excellent. The whole complex is immaculately clean and the heated pool at this time of year was a bonus. Hotel entertainment in the evenings was also good.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved this hotel, for a.i it was five star,food very good drinks inc cocktails were great,excellent value with travelrepublic.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed upon our arrival because our room overlooked three scrubby trees and a wall, we asked if we could up- grade, and yes we could, but the price for a view was exorbitant.
reviews.title: lovely winter break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our holiday progressed however, we began to really enjoy the atmosphere and the food. in fact at the end we had had a really good holiday. Our room was very comfortable and clean, the staff in the dining room were great, and the hotel facilities were excellent
reviews.title: Excellent choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from our weeks holiday, we would recommend the hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Outstanding food, service and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi Everyone, We, that is me(age 60) , my partner(55) and my Dad (87... And he is very fussy about where he goes on holiday) stayed at the Seaside Jameos Playa in February 2012 (All Inclusive) and had a mostly FABULOUS TIME ... Even my Dad said he would happily go back again!!!!
reviews.title: Me(60), my Partner(55) and my Fussy Dad (87) had a Mostly FAB Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: LOCATION (Good)
reviews.title: Hands-on hotel manager, friendly staff, excellent food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet part of the resort mid way between the airport (no noticeable noise, but DEF worth a walk down the prom to the end of the Runway to see the Planes come in!!!) and Puerto Del Carmen. PDC is 20/30 minute stroll or ten minute (stops a lot) bus ride away
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Made by the Staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Outside the hotel there are ample Supermarkets (inc. a SPAR), shops and restaurants
reviews.title: Nice hotel but room needed modernising.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: FOOD (Very Good)
reviews.title: Our family holiday with great friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel on the basis of the other reviews and was not disappointed.
reviews.title: Escaped the snow and found the sunshine at this lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can only endorse the other positive reviewers' comments. An exceptional hotel, maintaining consistently high standards.
reviews.title: Brilliant, Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week (14 - 21 January) and everything was first class. Minor niggle was our room - standard, garden view and small. Even so, exceptional value for what we had paid (ASDA accommodation and Monarch flight from Luton). We were offered a room upgrade, but it would have cost just over £200 for the week - so we stayed put.
reviews.title: 4* food but not 4* rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was outstanding. The soups, fish, meat, fruit and patisserie were of a high standard - a good indication of the quality of the base product used by this establishment and it produced consistently high end meals for the duration of our holiday. Sometimes when 'all-inclusive' the service suffers - but not in the case of the Jameos Playa Hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel. Should be classed as 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is spotlessly clean, the management are up-front and can be seen ensuring guests are receiving a good holiday experience. The staff work hard and are always keen to please and have a smile and a friendly manner toward guests.
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009
reviews.text: We booked to go to Los Jameos last year. There were 4 families in all totalling 16 people. The hotel is clean and the staff are very nice. They must be under order to say hello to everyone as every staff member either said Good morning or hello if i caught their eye. I can't say enough nice things about the staff there.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but we all got ill with the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pools are nice and nit heated so hold your breath when you jump in. Ifyou have kids watch out for them playing on the decorative rocks as they look damgerous to me.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - good food - helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small spa pool full of kids by the kids club that i would keep away from. It slowly turned yellow from you know what.
reviews.title: Can't wait to get back....bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffets are nice but i have to say every member of the 16 group got sick from both ends. It particularly worried me when my 7yr old became very ill and i was forced to take her to the hotel doctor which cost me 80 Euro for 5 mins. Its difficult to say if it was the food or the pool but i heard stories of numerous others in the hotel getting ill throughout the 2 weeks.
reviews.title: Well worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Entertainment?... Non existant. The night time entertainment resembled a 1980's butlins attempt and was poor. They really need to improve the evening entertainment. Magic tricks and bird acts don't cut it for a 4 star. The only one night that was received well was the ABBA night if you like that sort of thing. They really need somethinhg that doesn't consist of a one man band with 30 kids running on the dancefloor skidding on their knees.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - not for teenagers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel end May and had a great overall stay.
reviews.title: Good Overall Stay
Very Nice
reviews.text: Good Points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location – very near the beach and only a few minutes from Purto Del Carmen (3.50 in taxi).
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel !

likes.disliked: — fabrics a little dated but okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent pool area – always loads of sun loungers and umbrellas. Pool fantastic.
reviews.title: Faultless!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean facilities
reviews.title: A Canarian Delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned and found the food and service of the hotel excellent, each evening the choice and quality of food excellent. The only downfall was building work being carried out and the noise and the air con wasn't that good in the room.We paid for a shuttle bus £12 pound each way each you can get a taxi from airport for 11 euros
reviews.title: great fully inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But if you are looking for a fully inclusive with out the cattle market feeling this is definately the hotel to go to
reviews.title: Los Jameos Playa - Hopefully a balanced view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Los Jameos Playa from the 6th of May; our first experience of All Inclusive and our first visit to Lanzarote.
reviews.title: UNFORSEEN PROBLEMS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Having booked this trip some months ago it has been interesting to watch the tone of the reviews for this hotel change with the busy period over the Easter holidays. Hopefully I can add some views, tips and comments to help future visitors.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good hotel. The staff work very hard and we found them to be generally pleasant and helpful. This is a huge complex made up of several different buildings and we kept finding things as the week went on. We found the two turtles in the fish pond on day 5, the pleasant palm garden area behind the La Gomera building on day 6 and the sign pointing to the “Zona Nudista” on day 7 – but we never actually got there!
reviews.title: excellent , couldn,t fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Really nice hotel, clean, you can feel the relaxing atmosphere, delicious food especially fish of your choice cooked in front of you, also other meats are available and different type of food on each night. You can be spoiled for choices, food is served in very convenient hours. Good choice of drinks and cocktails, there is no snacks in between the meals so make sure your children eat properly their meals. Nice pools, also 2 small polls for children. Close to the beach, just across the street, also few shops and pubs outside the hotel. Good entertainment for children, especially the mini disco. Great service, friendly and helpful stuff. Great location, less than 15 min from the airport. We would love to go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxing, clean, family friendly Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 7 nights here last week and can honestly say it is the best holiday hotel I have ever experienced. Excellent quality food and wide choice with carvery dishes each night offering a choice of 5 meats, also a choice of 5 fishes as well as a different country theme each evening offering foods of that nation. Additionally a vast range of starters, salads and desserts all on a self-service basis. Waiter service provide drinks which are all premier products including soft drinks which are bottles of coca cola, fanta etc.
reviews.title: First Class in every aspect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were cleaned on a daily basis and were spotless. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them.
reviews.title: Another Fantastic Stay in Lanzarote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only negative I could say was that whilst we were initially pleased to have english tv channels - Sky Sports 1, Sky News and BBC News, on our departure we spoke to someone else and they had all the usual BBC and ITV channels plus sky sports 2 and 3> Not sure why there should be different availability in different rooms?
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely return and already looking at availability for next year
reviews.title: Great 2 weeks in this hotel
Stunning Hotel and Grounds but..
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there when we got married in Lanzarote in September 06. The hotel and grounds were spectacular. Our room had a small veranda but overlooked the beach and sea. It was ideal for us as our wedding reception was held across the road at Leneghans. We stayed there for 2 weeks on a B&B basis but never actually made it up in time as breakfast had finished serving at 10am. As we were the only two from the wedding party staying there, we felt we didn't get a chance to take advantage of the restaurant and bar etc as we were expected to meet family and friends at locations close to the centre. The majority of people staying there were families and elderly couples, so unfortunately the nightlife was a bit on the quiet side for us. Overall it's a wonderful hotel and has excellent amenities for all. We had our wedding photos taken on the grounds so I can't really fault it too much. Although the centre of Puerto del Carmen was only a few mins away in taxi, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to people looking for a late night. We met a couple on their honeymoon on our last day and they found themselves venturing outside the hotel for a late night drink. There are a few Irish bars within walking distance and the Kinsale Restaurant outside the grounds serves fantastic food.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: We booked this all inclusive holiday flights with Excel and the hotel with Relaxabroad.com. First of all the Hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport but we did not notice any aircraft noise during our stay. The hotel is fantastic all the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was very spacious and clean. The food was out of this world like dining in an exclusive restuarant every night. There is not much to do around the hotel but Puerto del Carmen is just a short taxi ride away if you fancy a change. This is probably one of the best hotels we have stayed in in the Canaries. We will def be going back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our Honeymoon Sept'03 and it was so good we came back again in May'06.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is excellent, massive variety, buffet style. Fruit,veg,salads,desserts inside. Grills,roasts,fish cooked outside right in front of you.
reviews.title: Los Jameos Surprise

likes.disliked: — Rooms a bit sparse & could do with a lick of paint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Tip! Just try alittle of each thing, we learned this the hard way after stuffing ourselves on the first night with steak,duck,roast lamb,grilled chicken all on the one plate. All Drinks will be put on your bill, including water.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife and 4 year old son for 2 weeks from 8/4/07 to 22/4/07 and had an excellent time.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, will be back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were welcomed at reception with a glass of cava and our bags were whisked away to our room. We had a standard double with a fold up bed in the room for my son – the rooms are not a fantastic size, I would go to say that with the extra bed and the furniture in the room they were a little on the small side but we didn’t spend much time in there so no real hassle. We had a sea view room (no 3067) which was nice, these rooms are on the land side by the road so were a little noisy but it’s not a very busy road.
reviews.title: Overcrowded....But lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were well equipped with plenty of storage and a nice bathroom. Clean towels were given everyday if you left your towels on the floor otherwise they were replaced twice a week. The rooms were maided every day with clean bed linen twice a week also. A complimentary bottle of cava and water were provided on the first day but these were not replaced (shame!)
reviews.title: Wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 2 pools – one heated and one not. The heated pool was busy the first week as it was Easter but we never had a problem finding a bed, only some days we were not on the edge of the pool but there are only about 20 beds there so you would need to get up early to nab one of these! The hotel provides pool towels for a small deposit which means you don’t need to take your own. Beds are reserved in the mornings so I suggest you nab a good bed on the way to breakfast, we always did this about 9-9.30 and never had a problem getting a bed. I was told by a fellow guest that in the height of summer getting a bed is chaos so if you are thinking of staying here best to visit out of season.
reviews.title: Pillows from Heaven

likes.liked: — Away from main Puerto del Carmen strip

reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
reviews.text: I wished we had booked direct with the hotel as the nightly rates per person (half board) for out of season is about 80 euros p.p per night with kids under 7 free – a lot cheaper than booking with an agent. The hotel is 5-10 minutes from the airport and the taxi cost less than 10 euros each way. All inclusive adds another 25 euros p.p to the price of your stay but if you are big drinkers or big eaters then this may be worth it as beers are 4 euros a half litre and sprits about 5, with wine about 15 per bottle. All inclusive also gives you the option to eat lunch in the buffet restaurant which is a scaled down version of the evening service. There are also pool bars serving light meals, fruit, sandwiches, burgers etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the first time we've been to the hotel and really enjoyed our 11 days, we have a 3 year old and the mini club and children's disco were great. I did laugh about the review moaning about the birds, there are a few sparrows flighing about, they do get into the restaurant sometimes but that's it! I don't know how you can be horrified by them!
reviews.title: Great for young families, don't worry about the birds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food
reviews.title: Third holiday and will return next year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really good selection of food and freshly prepared, got a bit samey towards the end but can't complain. I'm not a pudding fan but I must say the the cakes and ice cream were the best I've ever tasted at a hotel!
reviews.title: Definitely worth paying for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Entertainment
reviews.title: Management "Spin"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: If you have young kids this place is great, mini club in the day and disco and games in the evenings and all run by a really enthusastic team. Led by DARIO who is amazing, my daughter loved him and he is the main reason we would go back, I would recommend the hotel keep him at any cost!!!
reviews.title: Unbelievable choice and quality buffet
following on from the review below
reviews.text: I also have not yet travelled yet but have had practically the same situation as the lady below below. I booked a junior suite through holidaynights.com and paid for it, over the phone last night. i was then called back 2 hrs later to be told this room was not available any more, although when I booked I was told their system worked in live time. All they could do is refund my money. I was very stressed at this point as I had already booked my flights to come at the start June. i could not find another junior suite available online and so I booked a family room which was stated as being the last one left, through another website. I called the hotel reservations today and spoke to Maria, as I wanted to upgrade to a junior suite. Maria also went above the call of duty, checking my booking was confirmed and sorting out my upgrade and allocating the room/view/floor we wanted. She was very helpful and patient and spoke perfect English. This is my second dealing with reservations this week and if the holiday is anything like the service I have received through the reservations department, then I can not wait!!! Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a week on all inclusive terms. First impressions were good with a fairly impressive atrium and a warm and efficient greeting from a helpful reception. Our room was good sized with acceptable furniture and lighting. There was air-conditioning but we never had to use it. The hotel wanted 15 Euros for the use of a safe in our room which these days is totally unacceptable (and rather petty) for a 4 star hotel.The bath was more of a French style tub than a full size bath but overall we were well satisfied with our accommodation.
reviews.title: overall a Good Standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has extensive and well maintained grounds which were pleasant to sit in. I didn't use the pool or the sunloungers but it looked as if there was plenty room for everyone. There was entertainment in the evening in the piano bar (off the atrium) and in a larger bar situated across from the reastaurant. The piano bar featured pianists who were very good and it was a pleasant environment. In the other bar the acts were excellent and professional but it would be helpful if a time limit for children (9.00 pm?) could be enforced in order to help parents who find it difficult to realise that there is a time for adults and a time for children and that young children running about wild in the late evening is not a good idea! Management might like to consider this suggestion!
reviews.title: Just fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the food was buffet style. It was not the best buffet I have encountered but it was not the worst. The biggest advantage was that it was so extensive that you would be unlucky not to be able to find something which you liked as a large variety of food in many different styles was on offer. The main problem perhaps was the common problem of buffets of keeping food warm. For example, the vegetables and the soup were seldom warm enough and I would advise anyone who wanted chips to hang about for a fresh delivery of them! But the food was quite good overall.
reviews.title: Quality as standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was well maintained and the staff were excellent - helpful efficient and pleasant. It is well situated just out of Puerto del Carmen in an area called Los Pocillos (which is nicely adrift from the bustle of the main town) and next to the hotel is an enclave of bars and shops which add to the area. It is situated about 10 minutes from the airport which is obviously helpful for transfers. Lanzarotte itself is more than a typical Spanish Costa and there are a variety of organised trips at reasonable prices if you don't want the hassle of hiring a car.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Husband daughter and I were on an all inclusive basis for one week from the 3rd February. It was my husband and daughter`s birthday during our stay and the hotel hotel arranged with the restaurant staff evening to decorating our table for our evening meal and also added a bottle of Champagne.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: As my daughter has MS and needed an adapted room we stayed in rooms next to each other on the ground floor close to everything. The room were excellent and we had everything we required.
reviews.title: Fantastic - the perfect hotel for your Lanzarote holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel does a themed dinner every night, but whatever your taste you will always be able to find something to suit your requirement. My daughter and I are Celiac’s and had no problem at all. The choice of food is amazing and beautifully displayed.
reviews.title: Thank you Los Jameos Playa for our fabulous birthday week !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment at the hotel is excellent the night shows were very professionally. The staff were great and anything we asked or required was seen to straight away.
reviews.title: Our favourite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach was a stones throw away from the hotel and could be reached via a shortcut from the back of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastico!

description: The Seaside Los Jameos Playa is located alongside the beach of Los Pocillos in the quiet area of Puerto del Carmen. Architecturally inspired by the island style, the hotel has magnificent pools set in extensive landscaped palm gardens. Hotel guests can enjoy a wide variety of sports activities and entertainment, suitable for all ages, even for the youngest members of the family.
